title: Ticket #6944: Add JobEventLog API for intermittent readers
description: An API where the JobEventLog constructor takes an optional seek argument and has a tell() function would allow CMS (and the hopefully none others who used the old and broken API) to move to the JobEventLog API (and for us to remove the old API). This approach deliberately ignores the complexities inherent in a stop-and-start approach to reading rotating logs; we'll address those if someone should ever need that feature. (Currently, the only job event log which rotates is the schedd's event log.)
remarks:
2019-May-01 10:22:14 by tlmiller:
After discussion with BrianB and TJ, we'll move forward instead by pickling the whole JobEventLog object, instead. This should be easy to implement, and is an even weaker API than tell() and a seek parameter to the constructor; if we need those later, it won't hurt to have pickling. Since we don't anticipate the class getting much more complicated, maintaining the pickling code shouldn't be a burden.

2019-Jul-10 14:11:09 by tlmiller:
Delaying documentation (and thus officially supporting this API) until CRAB verifies that it works for them.

2019-Jul-31 16:57:30 by tlmiller:
Josh has verified that it works for him. Poking CRAB.

2019-Aug-29 11:14:21 by tlmiller:
Still haven't heard back from CRAB, but it's not the end of the world if we have to change our mind about something in dev series.
